channel.title: funny on Konigi
channel.description: Recent content in funny on Konigi

item.title: Now that's a big-assed button
Dilbert on User Experience
item.description: 90 Percent of Everything's collection of Dilbert on UX comic strips. Via Nick F. http://www.90percentofeverything.com/2009/05/26/dilbert-on-user-experience/

item.title: A Christmas Time Easter Egg on Flickr
item.description: That's BJ Fogg in my wireframe screenshot on Flickr, sporting a Santa hat and beard. This was spotted via Lifehacker. Add a note with the text "ho ho ho hat" to get the hat, and "ho ho ho beard" for the beard. I ♥ Flickr. http://www.flickr.com/photos/jibbajabba/3118649132/

item.title: Let me google that for you
item.description: Today's RTFM. A far less sarcastic way of telling people to not be so lazy. Via swissmiss. http://letmegooglethatforyou.com/

item.title: OS X Snow Leopard vs. Windows 7
item.description: Excellent infographic in the Onion comparing Snow Leopard and Windows 7. http://www.theonion.com/content/infograph/os_x_snow_leopard_vs_windows

item.title: SNL Megapixel Giant Touch Map
item.description: Not to be outdone by CNN's Chuck Todd or John King, SNL Weekend Update's Fred Armisen previews their Megapixel Giant Touchmap. http://www.hulu.com/watch/40678/saturday-night-live-update-freds-mapfix-it?c=98:255

item.title: Typocalypse
item.description: Lars Willem Veldkampf's Typocalypse flickr set exposes the subliminal messages in type. http://flickr.com/photos/larsveldkamp/sets/72157607710779069/

item.title: LOVE Creative Manchester
item.description: "Created In Powerpoint" they say. This very simple, witty flash site for the agency Love Creative deserves to be here for its witty, big buttoned, black and white interface alone. http://www.lovecreative.com/

item.title: LogÃ³logos
item.description: Yes, clearly, that's what they must have been thinking about when they made that logo. Log√≥logos proposes even more of the equations that describe popular logo design concepts. http://logologos.blogspot.com/

item.title: Do websites need to look exactly the same in every browser?
item.description: That's one hell of a domain name: http://dowebsitesneedtolookexactlythesameineverybrowser.com/ http://dowebsitesneedtolookexactlythesameineverybrowser.com/

item.title: Sh*tty Data Visualization
item.description: I like single serving sites. The Letter pointed to this one, which shows the number of links to variations of the phrase "oh shit" when using multiple i's. I wonder about the freshness of these results though, and I think the scale of the bars is a little off. :) http://www.ohshiit.com/
